South Bluff Teaching Family Home
Dear Mr. Whalen:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact Claudia Triestram,
Area Manager at (616) 552-3662 with any questions.

III. METHODOLOGY
06/07/2021 Special Investigation Intake
2021C0102029
06/07/2021 Special Investigation Initiated - Telephone
Called Stephanie Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant for Indian
River Teaching Family Home and South Bluff Teaching Family
Home to get an update on this complaint.
06/08/2021 Contact – Face to Face
Interviewed Director 1 and Social Worker 6
06/10/2021 Contact - Telephone call made
Called Director 1 explaining MiSACWIS problems reported by
email by Central Office Staff 9. Central Office Staff 9 sent a
second email.
07/21/2021 Contact – Email Received
Received Teaching Family Homes restraint policy
09/22/2021 Contact - Telephone call made
Called and interviewed Social Worker 6
09/29/2021 Contact - Telephone call made
Called Director 8

ALLEGATION:
The facility is not entering restraints into MiSACWIS as required per emergency
rules, despite emergency rules being in place for several months.
INVESTIGATION:
Director 1 and Social Worker 6 were interviewed at the facility on June 8, 2021.
Social Worker 6 said her access to MiSACWIS was blocked because she had not
signed into MiSACWIS in a couple of months. She said that there had not been any
reportable restraints before she tried to sign in.
Social Worker 6 sent me emails showing seven restraint were not properly recorded
in MiSACWIS.
Central Office Staff 8 sent me an email on June 10, 2021, which said that
MiSACWIS access is lost if the user does not log into MiSACWIS within a 60-day
period, which is what occurred. Social Worker 8 applied to regain access but was
denied on May 26, 2021 because she did not put down a sufficient reason for
needing access.
Central Office Staff 9 sent the following email on June 10, 2021:
In looking at Social Worker 6’s MiSACWIS record she was auto terminated back
on 2/20/2021. It looks like her request from 5/26/2021 was denied because her
request reason to gain her access back was not sufficient. It looks like she
submitted a new request on 06/03/2021 that is pending with Application Security
for approval. There is one request for access through South Bluff and one for
Indian River. Each “home” requires the user to have a profile set up under that
contract to do the Incident Report for the youth in that home.
For Director 1, he also submitted a new request on 5/17/2021 for access as he
was auto terminated.
Central Office Staff 9 sent another email on June 10, 2021, which read in part:
Social Worker 6 put her reason as “add back to MiSACWIS”. The denial from
Application security said “The request reason provided by the user is not
sufficient. For audit purposes, the request reason should provide details
explaining how each of the requested user groups access will assist the user with
completing their job duties.”
…It appears that we have a hierarchy issue, as Social Worker 6 has listed
Director 1 as her supervisor, and Director 1 does not have access, and Dustin
has listed Director 8, who has not done any requests in DSA so even if

everything was done perfectly by Social Worker 6 and Director 1, it would be held
up because Director 8 has not done his part.
I received an email on July 21, 2021, with Teaching Family Homes restraint policy which
did not mention MiSACWIS. I replied and received their Critical Incident Reporting for
Emergency Rule Implementation which listed steps to report in MiSACWIS.
I received a copy of an email dated September 13, 2021, which Social Worker 6 said
“Attached are all incident reports from 7/25/21 until now that have been entered into
MiSACWIS”
I called Director 8 on September 29, 2021, who said Director 1 went on leave on
September 16, 2021 and did not return.
APPLICABLE RULE
Rule 2 Prohibition of Prone Restraint; Procedures Involving Other
Restraints in Child Caring Institutions
(d) Procedures to submit the incident report regarding all
restraints within 12 hours to the parent or legal guardian in
writing and in writing to the Michigan Department of Health and
Human Services within 24 hours, as well as the review and
aggregation of incident reports regarding restraints at least
biannually by the CCI's director or designee.
ANALYSIS: The facility did not enter any physical restraints in MiSACWIS
for several months, evidenced by those responsible, Director 1
and Staff 6, having not used MiSACWIS for at least 60 days,
losing access and not requesting access back timely or
appropriately. While the emergency rules have expired
7/16/2021, this requirement has been built into your contract;
therefore, requiring corrective action.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended this
investigation be closed.
